title: Set de Ejercicios Mixtos 2 - Gramática y Vocabulario
description: Segunda colección de ejercicios variados que integran todos los temas: obligación, preferencias, make/do, deducciones modales, adjetivos descriptivos, phrasal verbs, palabras confusas y vocabulario laboral.

questions.question: Which sentence shows the correct use of 'make' vs 'do'?

answerOptions.text: I need to make an appointment with the dentist.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Make an appointment' es la expresión correcta.

answerOptions.text: I need to do an appointment with the dentist.
answerOptions.rationale: Con 'appointment' siempre usamos 'make', no 'do'.

answerOptions.text: I need to take an appointment with the dentist.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Take' no se usa con 'appointment' en este contexto.

questions.hint: ¿Qué verbo se usa para crear una cita médica?

questions.question: Complete with the correct modal for possibility:
questionParts: be late because of the traffic.
questions.hint: 'Might' expresa posibilidad cuando no estamos seguros.

questions.question: 'Information' and 'advice' are both uncountable nouns.
questions.explanation: Tanto 'information' como 'advice' son sustantivos incontables. No decimos 'informations' o 'advices'.

questions.question: Choose the strongest way to express preference:

answerOptions.text: I'd rather die than eat broccoli!
answerOptions.rationale: 'Would rather... than...' expresa preferencia muy fuerte.

answerOptions.text: I prefer not to eat broccoli.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Prefer' es más suave que 'would rather'.

answerOptions.text: I don't like broccoli.
answerOptions.rationale: Esto expresa disgusto, no preferencia comparativa.

questions.hint: ¿Qué estructura expresa la preferencia más dramática?

questions.question: Match the adjectives with their intensity level:
questions.hint: Algunos adjetivos expresan emociones más intensas que otros.

questions.question: Complete with the phrasal verb:
questionParts: a minute? I need to finish this call.

questions.question: What's the noun form of 'organize'?

answerOptions.text: organization
answerOptions.rationale: 'Organization' es el sustantivo derivado de 'organize'.

answerOptions.text: organizer
answerOptions.rationale: 'Organizer' es la persona que organiza, no el concepto.

answerOptions.text: organizing
answerOptions.rationale: 'Organizing' es el gerundio, no el sustantivo formal.

questions.hint: ¿Cuál es el sustantivo que describe el acto o sistema de organizar?

questions.question: 'You'd better not smoke here' expresses strong advice or warning.
questions.explanation: 'Had better' expresa consejo fuerte o advertencia, especialmente en forma negativa.

questions.question: Which shows a logical deduction about the past?

answerOptions.text: They must have left early - the meeting room is empty.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Must have' + participio expresa deducción lógica sobre el pasado.

answerOptions.text: They had to leave early - the meeting room is empty.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Had to' expresa obligación pasada, no deducción.

answerOptions.text: They should have left early - the meeting room is empty.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Should have' expresa lo que era recomendable, no deducción.

questions.hint: ¿Qué estructura expresa conclusión lógica sobre eventos pasados?

questions.question: Complete the expression:
questionParts: some research before making a decision.

questions.question: What's the difference between 'look' and 'expression'?

answerOptions.text: 'Look' is more casual; 'expression' is more formal.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Look' es más informal y común; 'expression' es más formal.

answerOptions.text: They mean completely different things.
answerOptions.rationale: Ambos se refieren a la apariencia facial.

answerOptions.text: 'Expression' is only for emotions; 'look' is only for appearance.
answerOptions.rationale: Ambos pueden referirse tanto a emociones como apariencia.

questions.hint: Piensa en qué palabra usarías en conversación casual vs. escritura formal.

questions.question: Complete: After working 12 hours, I'm absolutely _____.
questions.explanation: 'Exhausted' expresa cansancio extremo después de mucho trabajo físico o mental.

questions.question: Which expresses the strongest obligation?

answerOptions.text: You must submit the report by Friday.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Must' expresa la obligación más fuerte, especialmente en contextos formales.

answerOptions.text: You should submit the report by Friday.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Should' expresa recomendación, no obligación fuerte.

answerOptions.text: You need to submit the report by Friday.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Need to' es fuerte, pero 'must' es más autoritativo.

questions.hint: ¿Qué modal suena más autoritativo y definitivo?

questions.question: Complete the phrasal verb:
questionParts: and stop worrying about the exam.

questions.question: The word 'huge' can be used for both physical size and importance.
questions.explanation: 'Huge' puede describir tamaño físico ('a huge building') o importancia/impacto ('a huge mistake').

questions.question: What does 'make a living' mean?

answerOptions.text: To earn enough money to support yourself.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Make a living' significa ganar dinero suficiente para vivir.

answerOptions.text: To create a life plan.
answerOptions.rationale: Eso sería 'make a plan' o 'plan your life'.

answerOptions.text: To build a house.
answerOptions.rationale: Eso sería 'build a house' o 'make a home'.

questions.hint: 'Living' aquí se refiere a sustento económico.

questions.question: Express inability/impossibility:
questionParts: be the right answer - it doesn't make sense.
questions.hint: 'Can't' expresa imposibilidad o deducción negativa fuerte.

questions.question: Which is correct about salary vs. income?

answerOptions.text: My salary is $50,000, but my total income is higher because of investments.
answerOptions.rationale: Salary es el pago del trabajo; income incluye todas las fuentes.

answerOptions.text: My income is $50,000, but my total salary is higher because of investments.
answerOptions.rationale: Los conceptos están invertidos.

answerOptions.text: Salary and income always refer to the same amount.
answerOptions.rationale: Income puede incluir más fuentes que solo el salary.

questions.hint: ¿Cuál es más específico (trabajo) y cuál más general (todas las fuentes)?

questions.question: Arrange to form a preference sentence:
questions.explanation: La estructura es: I would rather + verb + option 1 + than + option 2.

questions.question: What's the noun form of 'employ'?

answerOptions.text: employment
answerOptions.rationale: 'Employment' es el sustantivo que describe el estado de tener trabajo.

answerOptions.text: employee
answerOptions.rationale: 'Employee' es la persona que trabaja, no el concepto.

answerOptions.text: employer
answerOptions.rationale: 'Employer' es quien da trabajo, no el concepto general.

questions.hint: ¿Cuál es el sustantivo abstracto que describe tener un trabajo?

questions.question: Complete with the extreme adjective:
'Had better' is always followed by the infinitive without 'to'.
questions.explanation: 'Had better' se sigue del infinitivo sin 'to': 'You'd better go' (no 'to go').

questions.question: Which phrasal verb means 'to solve a problem'?

answerOptions.text: work out
answerOptions.rationale: 'Work out' puede significar hacer ejercicio o resolver un problema.

answerOptions.text: chill out
answerOptions.rationale: 'Chill out' significa relajarse.

answerOptions.text: hold on
answerOptions.rationale: 'Hold on' significa esperar.
